low: Cold water below normal slows fish energy use, eat less and grow slower
Low temperature makes fish defenses weak, easier for parasites to attack
Cold weather delays fish spawning and fewer baby fish eggs survive
Water too cold slows body processes, harder digest food and nutrients
Cold water holds less oxygen, forcing fish work harder to breathe
Low heat makes fish use energy stay warm, reducing harvest weights
Cold conditions make fish lose appetite, getting thin from lack nutrition
Temperature too low affects baby-making chemicals, messing breeding times
Cold temperature slows healing from wounds, increasing sickness chance
Cold weather slows germ breakdown, affecting food release for plants
high: Hot water above normal shocks fish suddenly, hurting breathing parts and oxygen
High temperature speeds fish energy use, needs more oxygen, causing stress
Heat affects baby fish making, reducing egg quality and baby production
Water too hot weakens fish defenses, making targets for diseases
Hot conditions push oxygen out water, causing fish suffocate and die
High heat makes harmful wastes dangerous, poisoning fish bodies
Heat changes fish eating habits, eating less feed and losing weight
Temperature extremes grow bad germs fast, making water dirty and sickening
Hot water makes fish tired and lazy, harder catch during harvest
High temperatures grow bad algae fast, poisoning fish and plant crops
